    • Constructor Detail

      • URLHelper

        public URLHelper(String url)

    • Method Detail

      • getEverythingBeforeQuery

        public String getEverythingBeforeQuery()
        Everything before the "query" part of the URL. E.g. for "http://www.example.com/file?firstname=Bob&lastname=Smith#foo" this would be "http://www.example.com/file".

      • setEverythingBeforeQuery

        public void setEverythingBeforeQuery(String everythingBeforeQuery)

      • getQuery

        public String getQuery()
        Rturns the "query" portion of the URL, e.g. the "?firstname=Bob&lastname=Smith" part. m_query contains the query (including "?"), or "" if the URL has no query. Never null.

      • setQuery

        public void setQuery(String query)
        Sets the "query" portion of the URL. This must be either the empty string or a string that begins with "?".

      • getFragment

        public String getFragment()
        Returns the "fragment" portion of the URL, e.g. the "#foo" part, or "" if the URL has no fragment. Never null.

      • setFragment

        public void setFragment(String fragment)
        Sets the "fragment" portion of the URL. This must be either the empty string or a string that begins with "#".
        Parameters:
        fragment -

      • getURL

        public String getURL()
        Returns the entire URL.

      • getParameterMap

        public LinkedHashMap<String,String> getParameterMap()
        Returns the query portion of the URL, broken up into individual key/value pairs. Does NOT unescape the keys and values.

      • setParameterMap

        public void setParameterMap(Map<String,String> parameterMap)
        Sets the query portion of the URL.
        Parameters:
        parameterMap - a key/value mapping; these must already be escaped!

      • escapeSpace

        public static String escapeSpace(String uri)

      • escapeCharacter

        public static String escapeCharacter(String uri,
                     char c,
                     String to)
        Locates characters 'c' in the scheme specific portion of a URI and translates them into 'to'
